page.title: 07BOLSOVER COMMUNITY HOSPITAL.
page.content: The idea of a community hospital to serve the Bolsover area was first suggested in 1982. Work on the actual site was begun in 1985 and the hospital is due to open in 1987. The hospital is the responsibility of the Trent Regional Health Authority and will cost three and a half million pounds to build while running costs are calculated at a further million pounds per year. The Marlpit Lane site was selected because it was the only available area of flat land close enough to the town centre to ensure easy access for the elderly and infirm. It is expected that the hospital will be used by people from Bolsover,Shirebrook, Creswell, Clowne and the surrounding small villages.
